posts.cooked:
I had an idea for which I have not found anything here yet.
It would be very useful to be able to assign ‚Äúroles‚Äù to several members in groups. Similar to what is possible in Discord.
I was thinking for example of sports clubs, so you could have ‚Äúcoach‚Äù, ‚Äúorganization‚Äù, ‚Äútechnical support‚Äù and many more. The group members could then see this in the group overview as an addition or colored label behind the contact name and thus write specifically to the right person. Or specifically mention a group of people with @‚Äúcoach‚Äù in the chat.
These roles could be distributed by admins, just like you make other members admins.

What do you think? It would be nice for organizing large Groups.

link_counts.title: Roles/subtitles in Signal ‚Äì mark/decorate users in group chat
How can Signal be better for communities and organisers?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Seems like a great idea for a future update where groups have more control over what some members can or can‚Äôt do.

posts.cooked:
Confirmed by a Signal spokesperson as coming ‚ÄúSoon‚Äù:

AboutSignal.com ‚Äì 23 Jan 26

Signal is working on labels for groups - AboutSignal.com

Large Signal groups will soon become more organized thanks to labels in groups. With member labels, you can provide a short description about yourself, such as your role or title.

Est. reading time: 2 minutes

posts.cooked:
Will there be any protection against fake ‚Äúadmin‚Äù, ‚Äúmoderator‚Äù, etc. labels?
Also for ‚Äúadm1n‚Äù and ‚Äúm0der4t0r‚Äù kinds?

Update to WhatsApp today, is this going to be something similar or am I completely misinterpreting what I‚Äôm reading?

10001338221440√ó845 138 KB

Edit: Just saw the feature request thread: Group Members Custom Labels , really cool Exciting!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.72 release

posts.cooked: Seems so. Too bad that WA was faster (at least regarding announcement), but that‚Äôs no surprise given their dev team size.

With WhatsApp‚Äôs integration of this feature, apparently members are free to assign a custom label to themselves. In Signal, according to the article posted above, it seems that only administrators will be able to assign labels to group members.

Edit: Or no, it seems to work the same way as in WhatsApp, I misread that. Never mind.

link_counts.title: Signal is working on labels for groups - AboutSignal.com

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked: Users will always assign their own labels, but admins will have the ability to restrict it so that only admins can set a label for themselves.
Got it, thanks for the clarification!
